greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n/A328478(n), where A328478(n) is obtained by repeatedly dividing n by the largest primorial that divides it until a fixed point is reached.
comment: a(n) is the largest term in A025487 that divides n evenly. - _Hal M. Switkay_, May 04 2021
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..30030
Index entries for sequences related to primorial numbers
program: A111701(n) = forprime(p=2, , if(n%p, return(n), n /= p));
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 19 2019
